baseline_groups.claim_summary: The one-quarter hazard rate (fraction of new hires separating within one quarter) declined significantly over the 1999-2018 period in the US.
baseline_groups.notes: Descriptive trend claim, not causal. Treatment is a linear time trend measuring avg quarterly decline. Baseline uses national quarterly aggregates with HAC(4 lags) SE, N=76.

global_notes: Pries and Rogerson (2021, AEJ: Macro). 74 specs total. Data issue: robust/sample/drop_year_2018 has identical coef and N to baseline (year-drop not implemented). Many heterogeneity specs (demographics, industry, state) are non-core. 11 alternative outcome specs measure different turnover concepts, non-core since baseline claim is specifically about oneqhazrate.
